benchmark_details.name: User eXperience Perception Insights Dataset (UXPID)
benchmark_details.overview: The User eXperience Perception Insights Dataset (UXPID) is a dataset consisting of 7130 artificially synthesized and anonymized user feedback branches extracted from a public industrial automation forum, designed to facilitate research in user requirements and user experience (UX) analysis.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a valuable resource for advancing natural language processing (NLP) methods within industrial product support and software engineering domains.

data.source: User comments extracted from a company-operated forum dedicated to automation product hardware and software components.
data.annotation: Automatically generated insights through Large Language Models (LLMs) validated by human assessment.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated through classification tasks using the DistilBERT model as a baseline.
methodology.interpretation: Higher metrics indicate better model performance in classifying user experience feedback.
methodology.baseline_results: Predictive metrics for topic classification tasks yielded results with AUC scores indicating varying levels of success across scenarios.
methodology.validation: Technical validation conducted through classification experiments using the DistilBERT model.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The dataset includes anonymization techniques to protect user privacy.
